name: blocker
description: Blocker for the next release.

name: bug
description: A bug.

name: cleanup
description: Changes only making the code cleaner and that do not change how the code works nor the outputs produced (e.g. rubocop or eslint changes)

name: dependencies
description: Changes that affect dependencies, such as gem changes

name: developer
description: Changes that affect developers only, including non-customer-facing tools (e.g. changes to bin/setup)

name: documentation
description: Changes to documentation only (e.g. README.md)

name: duplicate
description: The issue is a duplicate. When applied, the duplicate issue should be referenced in a comment

name: enhancement
description: An enhancement

name: help wanted
description: An issue that could be handled by anyone, even new members of the community

name: internationalization
description: Changes that are for internationalization only (e.g. updating the *.po gettext files)

name: notabug
description: The issue is not a bug as reported or not reproducible. When applied the issue should be closed

name: performance
description: Changes that are for performance improvements only

name: pinned
description: The issue will not be marked with the stale label

name: question
description: Issues that are just questions. When the question is resolved, the label should be changed and/or the issue should be closed

name: refactoring
description: Changes in the way the code works internally without changing the output produced. Contrast to cleanup

name: stale
description: The issue is old and hasn't had activity in 6 months. This label will be automatically applied

name: technical debt
description: Changes that remove or significantly update old unused code and/or dependencies

name: test
description: Changes to test code only

name: tools
description: Changes to customer-facing tools (e.g. tools/prune_metrics.rb). Contrast to developer

name: unmergeable
description: The PR is unmergeable. This label is automatically applied and removed

name: verified
description: The bug issue was reviewed and is verified to have the problem stated and a PR should be created. This label is not necessary on a bug PR

name: wip
description: The PR is a WIP. This label is automatically applied and removed based on PR title having [WIP] or not

name: wontfix
description: The issue will not be fixed or otherwise handled. When applied, the issue should be closed
